bug.author: sarahmaddox
bug.summary: Broken link on Kubeflow deployment UI
bug.description:
On the Kubeflow deployment UI: <denchmark-link:https://deploy.kubeflow.cloud/>https://deploy.kubeflow.cloud/</denchmark-link>
There's a link to the docs that doesn't go anywhere useful. The link is currently: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-gke/#create-oauth-client-credentials>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-gke/#create-oauth-client-credentials</denchmark-link>
The link should be: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/deploy/oauth-setup/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/deploy/oauth-setup/</denchmark-link>
The link is on the word "instructions" in the following text: <denchmark-code>An endpoint protected by GCP IAP will be created for accessing kubeflow. Follow these instructions to create an OAuth client and then enter as IAP Oauth Client ID and Secret </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.86. Please mark this comment with 👍 or 👎 to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apps/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Will be fix in next image update.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
